text:
Changing a single field name in our LLM response schema improved accuracy from 4.5% to 95% on GSM8k.

The fix was simple: going from final_choice to final_answer. Turns out our model was returning a multiple-choice index instead of the actual answer.

If you're working with
author:

text:
How I use precision and recall to experiment with the size of top K.

If recall is good but precision is bad: try reducing top K.
If precision is good but recall is bad: try increasing top K.

But if recall and precision are bad, then first improve retrieval.
